page.title: 01WAVENEY VALLEY (HOMERSFIELD)
page.content: The dominant geographical feature is the River Waveney which bisects the block in a N.E. - S.W. direction. The river is not navigable here, but it is well stocked with coarse fish, and is extensively fished by local anglers. The water meadows by the river are subject to flooding and their use is confined to grazing and cropping for hay and silage. Gravel beds within the block are extensively worked and where excavation has been completed landscaping has produced attracive lakes, well used by wildfowl and fishermen. Homersfield (the former site of a Ramano/British Settlement) is a village of about 50 houses. It has a high percentage of retired people and the working population is mainly employed in industry outside the block. The other village within the block is Flixton, which is similar
